children.text: Good things are happening! American Rescue Plan Act funds are being put to work for homes and teachers. In Pennsylvania, residents are getting much needed funding for home improvements. Across the country, public schools are offering big signing bonuses to hire much needed teachers amid severe shortages. Also, Uber and Lyft drivers in California have organized and secured workplace and health protections for the first time ever. Meanwhile, Chipotle workers just won a major settlement.

Rideshare Drivers United, a group of Lyft and Uber drivers who have organized to demand full labor rights, launched a
for health protections during a COVID surge in February. After their petition was rejected, they filed the complaints with state regulators, which resulted in this victory.

“This is the first time that a state safety agency has extended workplace protections to gig workers, and challenges the companies’ (claim) that they have no responsibility to ensure safety of drivers,” Rideshare Drivers United

After all the news this week, take a moment to read Mary Oliver’s poem on amazing moments, “
I go down to the edge of the sea.
How everything shines in the morning light!
the broken cupboard of the clam,
moon snails, pale pink and barnacle scarred—
and nothing at all whole or shut, but tattered, split,
dropped by the gulls onto the gray rocks and all the moisture gone.
